file_content.text: Well? Get on with it!
Don't make me wait on you.
Was that the best you could do?
Is that all you've got?
If there's another test, let's continue.
I'm ready for the next trial.
Arrogance. Anger.
Impatience. Frustration.
Hunger. Overconfidence.
Emotions that drove you to kill an old ally in the Free Zone.
Emotions that drove you to kill a potential ally in the Free Zone.
You were more tolerant in the Free Zone, despite the fools you suffered.
You were watching me.
We're always watching. Arcann took away years of your life, but he stole far more from the rest of us.
No one deserves what Arcann's done. But he's earned what's coming and I'll make sure he gets it.
Arcann will face justice.
What's done is done. All that's left is revenge.
I want revenge, not regrets.
Why else would I be here? I want to end the suffering.
Of course I do.
And you, Senya? What do you feel?
Shame.
Because you failed to protect our Immortal Emperor?
I was in no position to do that.
What of the Scions who were slaughtered by your fellow Knights because Arcann demanded it? Do you feel responsible for them?
When I joined the Knights, they were shields protecting our home world. Now they are weapons wielded by an insane child.
The Knights killed the Scions on Arcann's orders? Why?
Why would Arcann do that?
The Knights will die with their leader. End of story.
Then they die with Arcann.
Senya, could we reason with the Knights? Bring them over to our side?
The Knights could be allies.
Because he thinks himself beyond the reach of destiny.
You would destroy an order that has stood for over a thousand years.
The blood on their hands cannot be washed away with reason.
The Knights should have rebelled against Arcann. Instead, we have lost our honor.
The Eyes of Esne claim what can never belong to her.
They speak of envy. My son's weakness. Do not let it be yours.
We receive no pleasure from this trial, but we act as fate demands. Be strong, Outlander.
Do you feel anything for those who suffered while you slept?
